Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that all members of Congress are required to take an oath to support and defend the U.S. Constitution at the start of each new Congress.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that all members of Congress, not just three, are required to take the oath.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that three Muslim congresswomen refused to sign the oath.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that refusing to sign the oath should disqualify someone from serving, without providing a valid reason for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the swearing-in ceremony has not yet taken place, so no members could have refused to sign the oath.
